segment.source: How to Set Up and Enable or Disable Authentication
segment.target: How to Set Up and Enable or Disable Authentication

segment.source: How to Set Up and Enable or Disable Authentication
segment.target: How to Set Up and Enable or Disable Authentication

segment.source: How to Set Up and Enable or Disable Authentication
segment.target: How to Set Up and Enable or Disable Authentication

segment.source: The Application Virtualization Server Management Console lets you enable or disable Windows authentication, which lets you to define who has access to the system.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization Server Management Console lets you enable or disable Windows authentication, which lets you to define who has access to the system.

segment.source: You can use the following procedures to set up and disable authentication from the Provider Policies Results pane of the console.
segment.target: You can use the following procedures to set up and disable authentication from the Provider Policies Results pane of the console.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Normally, you set up authentication when you add a provider policy through the New Provider Policy Wizard.
segment.target: Normally, you set up authentication when you add a provider policy through the New Provider Policy Wizard.

segment.source: To set up authentication
segment.target: To set up authentication

segment.source: Click the Provider Policies node to display the list of provider policies in the Results pane.
segment.target: Click the Provider Policies node to display the list of provider policies in the Results pane.

segment.source: Right-click the provider policy, and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the provider policy, and select Properties.

segment.source: Select the Provider Pipeline tab.
segment.target: Select the Provider Pipeline tab.

segment.source: Make sure the Authentication check box is selected.
segment.target: Make sure the Authentication check box is selected.

segment.source: Select the authentication level from the drop-down list.
segment.target: Select the authentication level from the drop-down list.

segment.source: Click Apply or OK.
segment.target: Click Apply or OK.

segment.source: To enable or disable authentication
segment.target: To enable or disable authentication

segment.source: Click the Provider Policies node to display the list of provider policies in the Results pane.
segment.target: Click the Provider Policies node to display the list of provider policies in the Results pane.

segment.source: Right-click the provider policy, and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the provider policy, and select Properties.

segment.source: Select the Provider Pipeline tab.
segment.target: Select the Provider Pipeline tab.

segment.source: Select the Authentication check box to enable authentication.
segment.target: Select the Authentication check box to enable authentication.

segment.source: Clear the box to disable it.
segment.target: Clear the box to disable it.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: How to Customize an Application Virtualization System in the Server Management Console
